results.title: At 13, She Fled the Nazis. At 95, She Runs a Storied Bohemian Hotel.

results.title: Her Doctor Said Her Illness Was All in Her Head. This Scientist Was Determined to Find the Truth.
results.abstract: After enduring severe nausea and vomiting in pregnancy, the geneticist Marlena Fejzo made finding the cause of her condition, hyperemesis gravidarum, her life’s work.

media.caption: Hyperemesis gravidarum, a pregnancy condition marked by nausea and vomiting so severe it can cause catastrophic complications for mother and fetus, has long been under-researched and insufficiently recognized.
media.copyright: Maggie Shannon for The New York Times

results.title: The Best Way to Comfort Someone When They’re Sad
results.abstract: A limited yet growing body of research suggests that one of the most powerful ways to support someone is also the simplest: Start a conversation.

results.title: Judge Rules Trump Lawyer Must Testify in Documents Inquiry
results.abstract: The ruling found that the government had met the threshold for the crime-fraud exception, which allows prosecutors to get around attorney-client privilege if they believe a crime has been committed.

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump tried to use attorney-client privilege to shield his interactions with M. Evan Corcoran, a lawyer who has represented him since last spring.
